metadata.ttm:title: eMod Sign In
metadata.ttm:desc: When you visit the eOffer/eMod site you will find the Sign In buttons for each of the two systems on the right-hand side. Both systems use the same initial log in process. In our example, we will assume this is the first time you have visited the site.

div.p: Before you can log into eOffer or eMod, you will
need a DUNS and a Digital Certificate.
A Digital Certificates are unique to a single person
and are associated with the organization for which
that person works.
To learn more watch the video topics about Digital
Certificates, there is a link provided for you on
the side.
A DUNS is a unique nine digit number, issued by
Dun and Bradstreet, used to identify individual
businesses throughout the US and the rest of the
world.
Begin by clicking the Sign In button under eMod.
If it is your first time logging into the system,
you will be asked to select your digital
certificate.
Go ahead and pick yours then click "OK."
On the "Sign-In" page, select your "DUNS" from
the drop down menu.
If you have not previously accessed the system, no
DUNS may be available.
In this case, you will need to manually type in
your DUNS and possibly your "DUNS plus 4".
The "DUNS plus 4" designation is used to
identify specific business units within the
organization.
If you don't know your DUNS or need to apply for
one, visit Dun and Bradstreet's homepage at
www.dnb.com.
When you have made your selection, click the
"Submit" button.
Next you will select the contract you wish you
modify from the dropdown menu.
Click "Select Contract" You will be taken to the
"My Modifications" page where you can submit new
modifications, review saved modifications, and
view submitted modifications, signed
modifications, and GSA initiated modifications.
